name: Betben's Movie Taglines Quiz | Movie Taglines | 10 Questions

questions.text: This 1995 movie's tagline was: "Attitude is everything".
questions.correct: To Wong Foo, Thanks for Everything! Julie Newmar
questions.explanation:
To Wong Foo, Thanks for Everything! Julie Newmar.

	This comedy starred Patrick Swayze, Wesley Snipes and John Leguizamo as three drag queens travelling across America.

questions.text: This 1992 movie's tagline was: "Her life began when her world fell apart."
questions.explanation:
Love Field.

	This movie focuses around the 1963 John F. Kennedy assassination and the effect it has on Lurene Hallet (Michelle Pfieffer).

questions.text: This 1978 movie's tagline was: "A man who believed in war! A man who believed in nothing! And a woman who believed in both of them!"
questions.explanation:
Coming Home.

	This movie tells the story of Sally Hyde (Jane Fonda) whose husband Bob (Bruce Dern) joins the Vietnam War.  Sally finds herself falling in love with a paraplegic Vietnam veteran (Jon Voight).  Academy Awards for both Fonda and Voight.

questions.text: This 1998 movie's tagline was: "An epic of miniature proportions".
questions.explanation:
A Bug's Life.

	This Pixar production casted the vocal talents of Kevin Spacey, Julia-Louis Dreyfus, David Foley and Phyllis Diller.

questions.text: This 1969 movie's tagline was: "A man went looking for America and couldn't find it anywhere!"
questions.explanation:
Easy Rider.

	This movie starred Dennis Hopper (who also directed) and Peter Fonda as two motorcycle bikers travelling across America.

questions.text: This 1994 movie's tagline was: "The Minnesota Twins Have a New Owner".
questions.explanation:
Little Big League.

	This comedy tells the story of 12-year-old baseball fan Billy Heywood (Luke Edwards) who inherits the Major League Baseball team, The Minnesota Twins. Also starring Timothy Busfield.

questions.text: This 1995 movie's tagline was: "Courage now, truth always..."
questions.explanation:
Batman Forever.

	This movie tells the story of Superheros, Batman (Val Kilmer) and Robin (Chris O'Donnnell) as they battle their enemies Two-Face (Tommy Lee Jones) and The Riddler (Jim Carrey).  Also starring Nicole Kidman as Dr. Chase Meridan.

questions.text: This 1955 movie's tagline was: "Filmed on location; inside a woman's soul".
questions.explanation:
I'll Cry Tomorrow.

	This movie was adapted from the autobiography of singer Lillian Roth (portrayed by Susan Hayward).  It chronicles the life of Roth with her rise to fame and her eventual downfall.  Also starring Eddie Albert and Jo Van Fleet.

questions.text: This 1988 movie's tagline was: "An out-of-this-world, down-to-earth comedy adventure".
questions.explanation:
Earth Girls Are Easy.

	This sci-fi/comedy starred Geena Davis as a manicurist.  When a spaceship from the planet Jhazzalan crash lands in her swimming pool she befriends the aliens that are aboard the ship.  The aliens were played by Jeff Goldblum, Jim Carrey and Damon Wayans.

questions.text: This 1939 movie's tagline was: "The most magnificent picture ever!"
questions.explanation:
Gone With the Wind.

	This classic movies tells the story of Scarlett O'Hara (Vivien Leigh) and her trials and tribulations with the man she loves, Rhett Butler (Clark Gable).  Academy Award winner for Best Picture, Best Actress in a leading role, Best Actress in a supporting role (Hattie McDaniel) and Best Director (Victor Fleming).
